item.title: Marvel Rivals Players Aren’t Happy About Its Latest Event
item.description:
Summary

  • Fans are frustrated with Marvel Rivals' Valentine's Day event.
  • Players have a chance to win the 60th Anniversary Bundle during the event by joining Quick Matches and entering the same lobby as a sponsored streamer.
  • However, players have reported instances of fellow fans joining lobbies only to leave them immediately, or intentionally throwing matches so they can try again.

Fans of Marvel Rivals have taken to social media to express frustration with NetEase Games' Valentine's Day Streamer Giveaway Event, stating that it is ruining their experience with the popular hero shooter. Marvel Rivals is preparing to launch its large mid-season update on February 21, which will add new heroes, a map, and balance changes to the game.

The Valentine's Day Streamer Giveaway Event is a limited promotion in which players have the opportunity to win the 60th Wedding Anniversary Bundle in Marvel Rivals . The cosmetic bundle includes new costumes for Mister Fantastic and Invisible Woman, along with nameplates, emotes, and a shared MVP screen. NetEase Games recently announced that fans could win the bundle for free by joining Quick Matches for a limited period of time and entering the same lobby as one of its sponsored streamers. Marvel Rivals ran a similar event shortly after the hero shooter's launch, though at that time winners were able to choose which bundle they wanted to receive.

In recent posts on Reddit, some fans have called NetEase Games' Valentine's Day Giveaway Event "one of the worst ideas" they've seen in a game. While the event is designed to give players a chance to win free skins in Marvel Rivals , many gamers are experiencing issues as they try to play Quick Match. In an attempt to join the same lobby as one of the sponsored streamers, numerous players are entering matches and trying to end them as quickly as possible. Gamers have reported instances of fellow fans joining lobbies only to leave them immediately, or intentionally throwing matches so they can try again.

Marvel Rivals’ Giveaway Is Causing Trouble for Quick Match Players

Marvel Rivals ' giveaway has received a lot of attention from the community, with many players tuning in to streams in order to try and join a Quick Match at the same time as one of the sponsored content creators. Furthermore, the giveaway takes place during limited windows of time and on specific servers, creating issues for players who normally play on those servers due to their region. Some gamers complained that the Frankfurt servers were overwhelmed with people joining and leaving matches due to the event.

This isn't the first time Marvel Rivals has courted controversy, as the developers recently stated that players would have their ranks reset in the middle of Season 1: Eternal Night Falls. Fortunately, mere hours after the announcement, NetEase Games altered its plans due to player feedback. Similarly, the popular hero shooter announced that players will have the entire season to earn Invisible Woman's Blood Shield skin, which was set to become unavailable with the mid-season update. Despite a few hiccups, many players are feeling optimistic about the future of Marvel Rivals .

item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Reveals What's Coming in Update 3
item.description:
Summary

  • Indiana Jones and the Great Circle Update 3 was recently detailed by Bethesda.
  • The update will include multiple bug fixes.
  • This should improve the experience for Great Circle players.

Bethesda has recently revealed more information about the upcoming Update 3 for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle , which will be released later in February. This new major update will fix bugs, improve the game, and add some new graphical features as developer MachineGames continues to support Indiana Jones and the Great Circle .

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle was released in December 2024, marking the return of the Indiana Jones franchise to video games after more than a decade. Developed by MachineGames and published by Bethesda, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle gained very positive reviews, achieving an average critic score of 87 on OpenCritic. However, the game was not released without a few glitches, and new updates have been correcting them and improving the overall experience since then.

Now, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle publisher Bethesda has revealed the content of the upcoming Update 3, which is expected to be out later in the month. According to Bethesda, the new update will bring improvements to the game and fix multiple bugs. As Indiana Jones is still known to have some game-breaking bugs, it’s expected that they will be fixed with the new patch. As revealed a few weeks ago, Patch 3 for Indiana Jones and the Great Circle will fix a known issue in Sukhothai that prevented gamers from achieving 100%. However, the biggest addition is that PC gamers will have support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation and DLSS Ray Reconstruction after the patch, which will likely allow them to play the game with even more stunning graphics.

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle's Update 3's Content Confirmed

  • Multiple bug fixes.
  • Undisclosed improvements.
  • Support for NVIDIA DLSS 4 with Multi Frame Generation and DLSS Ray Reconstruction.

It’s possible that these new updates may attract an even larger audience to Indiana Jones ’ latest game. According to Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, over 4 million people played Indiana Jones and the Great Circle by the end of January. With the title expected to be launched for PS5 during the first half of 2025, it’s likely that these numbers will become even bigger during 2025.

This success has even sparked rumors that Disney wants more Indiana Jones games. It remains to be seen, however, if future titles will be a direct sequel to The Great Circle or not. Reports indicate that MachineGames is working on multiple games, for example, but none of them have been announced. So, it’s possible that the developer may be in the first stages of developing a sequel for the popular action game, or something else entirely.

item.title: Destiny 2: Xur Exotic Armor, Weapon, and Recommendations for February 14
item.description:
Summary

  • Xur returns to Destiny 2 with new gear, weapons, resources, and exotics.
  • His armor selection this week is Young Ahamkara's Spine, Armamentarium, and Karnstein Armlets.
  • For exotic weapons this week, Xur has a new Hawkmoon roll, Sweet Business, Skyburner's Oath, and The Queenbreaker.

Xur has returned again to Destiny 2 , complete with new exotic and legendary gear for players to check out for a limited time. As Episode Heresy enters its second weekend, Bungie is making good for players impacted by last weekend's PlayStation Network outage. All Destiny 2 players will be getting a bonus weekend where Contest Mode for the Sundered Doctrine dungeon will be reactivated for a limited time. For those who want to brave the challenge, they'll be rewarded with new exotics like

As positive as the first weeks have been for Episode Heresy, it once again hasn't been entirely smooth. Unfortunately, players have run into issues, especially those who are attempting to play catch up or enjoy some of the legacy activities in the game. Specifically, Episode Heresy seems to have broken some older Destiny 2 content, with Bungie providing a list of things as "known issues" which include Kell's Fall, Onslaught: Salvation, and more.

With the arrival of the weekend, the exotic merchant Xur is back with a new inventory of gear for Destiny 2 players. Follow this guide for his current weekend location, news on his exotic cipher quest, as well as a review of all the exotic and legendary gear he's brought for the weekend of February 14, 2025.

Where is Xur?

Xur has now taken up permanent residence in the Bazaar area inside The Tower, so there's no more hunting when the weekend comes around.

Since the Bazaar is located between both fast travel points, players can pick either one to load into. Head into the area where Ikora and Hawthorne are and look for the Ramen Shop towards the back wall. While facing the shop, the alley is to the right, where Xur is standing.

Destiny 2 Class Armor and Exotic Cipher

Xur's role continues to offer the usual weekly quests, exotics, and legendary gear. Not only are these quests required to purchase a second fated engram, but they're necessary to acquire legacy exotic gear from the Tower kiosk. Players can earn a new cipher by completing strikes and winning crucible or gambit matches. Gain bonus points for playing with clan mates or finishing more challenging activities.

Xur's Exotic Armor

Karnstein Armlets - Warlock gauntlets

Exotic Perk :

  • Vampire's Caress - Melee and finisher final blows instantly grant cure and provide restoration for a short duration.

A solid exotic this week for Warlocks, as it provides a way to restore health. The only downside is that Mobility is higher than a player would want for this class.

Stat Values (66 Total):

  • Mobility +15
  • Resilience +16
  • Recovery +3
  • Discipline +10
  • Intellect +6
  • Strength +16

Young Ahamkara's Spine - Hunter gauntlets

Exotic Perk :

  • Wish-Dragon Teeth - Increases Tripmine Grenade duration and blast radius. Ability damage grants Tripmine Grenade energy.

The lowest exotic this week belongs to the Hunters and, considering how specialized it is, this one is hard to recommend as it offers zero benefits for players who aren't using tripmine grenades.

Stat Values (62 Total):

  • Mobility +10
  • Resilience +21
  • Recovery +3
  • Discipline +14
  • Intellect +7
  • Strength +7

Armamentarium - Titan chest armor

Exotic Perk :

  • And Another Thing - Gain an additional grenade charge. Grenade final blows spawn an Orb of Power.

Not particularly exciting, this exotic is still very useful for not only giving a second grenade charge but for spawning Orbs of Power.

Stat Values (65 total):

  • Mobility +7
  • Resilience +9
  • Recovery +19
  • Discipline +14
  • Intellect +2
  • Strength +14

Xur Inventory Items

Year 7 in Destiny 2 has upgraded Xur's inventory, adding a true rank progression system, rewards, as well as focusing options. Xur also has more than just weapons and armor as well, including:

  • Crimson Catalyst
  • Bad Juju Catalyst
  • The Xurfboard (Skimmer Board Vehicle)
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Ascendant Shard
  • Glimmer
  • Enhancement Core
  • Legendary Engram
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)

Xur's Exotic Weapons

Year 7's Xur revamp has also added the ability to offer multiple exotic weapons in one visit. Here is what Xur has this weekend:

Hawkmoon - Hand Cannon

  • Paracausal Shot - Final blows and precision hits with Hawkmoon grant stacks of Paracausal Charge. The final round in the magazine deals bonus damage based on the number of stacks. Stowing Hawkmoon on the final round removes this bonus.
  • Smallbore
  • Alloy Magazine
  • Eye of the Storm
  • Heavy Grip

Sweet Business - Auto Rifle

  • Payday - Larger magazine. Increased accuracy when firing from the hip. Picking up Special or Heavy ammo immediately reloads this weapon.
  • Business Time - Sustained fire boosts range and rate of fire.
  • Polygonal Rifling
  • Armor-Piercing Rounds
  • Composite Stock

Skyburner's Oath - Scout Rifle

  • Slug Rifle - This weapon lobs explosive slugs. When you're aiming down sights, the slugs travel fast and straight. When you're firing from the hip, the explosion is larger and applies Scorch to the target.
  • For The Empire - This weapon is Full Auto, does extra damage to Cabal, and penetrates Phalanx shields.
  • Extended Barrel
  • Extended Mag
  • Short-Action Stock

The Queenbreaker - Linear Fusion Rifle

  • Wire Rifle - Hold Reload to swap between scopes and alter this weapon's firing behavior.
  • Hip-Fire Grip - Increases accuracy, stability, and precision hit targeting when firing from the hip.
  • Marksman Sights
  • Combat Sights
  • Enhanced Battery
  • Quickdraw

Xur's Set of Legendary Armor and Weapons. All gear costs 50 Legendary Shards and 1000 Glimmer.

  • Rapacious Appetite (Kinetic SMG)

item.title: Obsidian Entertainment Shares Ambitious Goal for Its Future
item.description:
Summary

  • Obsidian Entertainment aims to be around until the year 2103 and has a detailed plan to achieve this long-term goal.
  • The company will focus on sticking to more realistic objectives to sustain growth steadily instead of aiming for record-breaking sales.
  • Obsidian also wants to prioritize its workers to keep morale high.

Obsidian Entertainment has shared that it wants to be around for 100 years and that the company already has a plan for making sure they're still around in 2103. Obsidian Entertainment, an Xbox Game Studios subsidiary, is known for hits like Pillars of Eternity and Fallout: New Vegas , most recently releasing Avowed , with The Outer Worlds 2 soon to follow sometime in 2025.

Plenty of recent attention has been focused on titles like Avowed , from the 22-year-old studio Obsidian Entertainment. Avowed draws plenty of comparison to Skyrim and others, leading some gamers to see the release as direct competition. Though it floats within the same realm, statements from Obsidian's executives largely signal that the company is focused on doing its own thing, and whether it does ultimately rival the legendary RPG is inconsequential.

Per a report from PC Gamer, Obsidian Entertainment's vice president of operations Marcus Morgan, and vice president of development Justin Britch have stated an intent for the company to last for 100 years. Although it shocked some to see such an extensive goal stated so plainly, the developers emphasized that this is a serious plan. Obsidian's VPs believe that the best way to achieve their goal is by sticking to objectives they consider to be more reasonable compared to the staggering budgets and sales expectations that other studios have. With games like Avowed dropping recently, this statement appears to highlight that Obsidian doesn't expect record-breaking sales, instead searching for just enough to continue growing at a modest rate.

Obsidian Entertainment Wants to Last Until the Year 2103

Morgan and Britch expanded on the ambitious goal for Obsidian Entertainment's future by laying out plans for the studio by the decade. They explain that this plan hinges on remaining "lean and invested." In addition to making sure that the developer retains the agility that companies like EA have restructured to find, Obsidian aims to ensure that its workers feel that they are valued, ultimately guaranteeing that they're motivated to succeed.

These types of goals echo what other recently successful developers have mentioned amid more turbulent times within the video game industry. Baldur's Gate 3 director Swen Vincke has spoken out against corporate greed, citing it as the main cause of mass layoffs that continue to impact many talented developers. The big idea at Obsidian is to set realistic goals and scale their projects accordingly. Although Obsidian has also faced layoffs before, it seems like this 100-year plan is likely a response to these kinds of experiences, so that the studio won't be put in similarly difficult situations down the road.

item.title: Steam Giving Away Free Game With 'Very Positive' Reviews for February 2025
item.description:
Summary

  • Steam users can grab Stellar Mess for free until Feb. 27.
  • Stellar Mess is a point-and-click adventure game inspired by classics of the genre.
  • A sequel is listed as "coming soon" on the platform.

Steam users have until February 27 at 12:00pm CST to claim Stellar Mess: The Princess Conundrum (Chapter 1) for their digital libraries for free. When it comes to free games, PC gamers don't always know when they'll be able to get one through Steam. Other platforms, like the Epic Games Store and GOG, have free game giveaways on a more regular, consistent basis.

This is likely because the Epic Games Store free games and the free titles given away on GOG seem to be giveaways hosted by the platform owners themselves, whereas the free Steam games are usually initiated by the publishers of the games. Regardless, between all the major platforms, PC gamers have a steady supply of free games that they can add to their various digital libraries.

The latest Steam free game is available now and will be up for grabs until February 27 at 12:00pm CST, at which point it will revert to its usual asking price of $4.99. Stellar Mess: The Princess Conundrum (Chapter 1) is free to claim on Steam right now, with absolutely no strings attached. And while it's a fairly obscure game in the grand scheme of things, Stellar Mess notably has "Very Positive" reviews from Steam users, so it's something that PC gamers should definitely get for free while they still can.

Stellar Mess is Free on Steam Right Now

Developed and published by Tibba Games, Stellar Mess: The Princess Conundrum (Chapter 1) is a 2D point-and-click adventure game inspired by the classics of the genre. In typical point-and-click fashion, players will navigate the Stellar Mess game world while solving puzzles and interacting with various objects using an old-school UI. Genre fans have responded well to Stellar Mess , and so those that have yet to play it should make sure that they don't miss this opportunity to get it for free.

Set in 1991, the game puts players in the shoes of comic book store owner Diego, who follows conspiracy theories surrounding the popular in-game movie franchise Stellar Battle . Diego is soon tasked with saving the Princess Lanor from the films. It's an interesting premise, though point-and-click adventure game fans will have to play the game for themselves to see what happens next.

Stellar Mess being free on Steam is likely a strategic move on the part of Tibba Games. As it so happens, Stellar Mess: Operation Kush (Chapter 2) is in active development, currently listed as "Coming Soon" on Steam. By giving away Stellar Mess for free, Tibba Games can potentially create new fans that will be willing to pick up the second chapter when it launches, whenever that may be.
